content.rendered:
New for 2025: Audio for 1975, 1985, and 1988

1975: Bruce and the “East Side Band” play their first-ever show in Missouri when the Born to Run Tour stops at the Ambassador Theater in St. Louis. The set list features a 27-minute(!) “The E Street Shuffle.”

1977: At the Record Plant in New York City, Bruce records “Because the Night,” “Outside Looking In,” and “Down by the River.” It will take more than 30 years for Bruce to release the first two; the last one still hasn’t been released to this day.

1980: Bruce and the boys rehearse for the upcoming River Tour at Clair Brothers Audio in Lititz, Pennsylvania, and the rehearsals are captured on video.

1985: The final stand of the marathon Born in the U.S.A. Tour begins at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, where Bruce plays both “War” and “Janey, Don’t You Lose Heart” for the very first time. “War” will continue to be a staple through the Tunnel of Love Tour, but “Janey” won’t be played again for eight years. This show is available as part of Bruce’s official archive series–get it here.

1988: The Human Rights Now! Tour lands in Asia, starting with a show at the Tokyo Dome, where Bruce tour debuts “I’m on Fire.”

1999: Night One in Chicago on the Reunion Tour features a standard Night One set list, but there are still two nights to go in this stand at the United Center.

2002: Milwaukee gets tour one-offs of “Mary Queen of Arkansas” and a show-closing “Little Queenie” (complete with “Are you loose?”) and a “No Surrender” tour premiere when the Rising Tour stops at the Bradley Center for a night.

2003: The Rising Tour is winding down, and each show of this last month is special. At Miller Park in Milwaukee (one year to the day since his last show in that city), Bruce opens with “Candy’s Room,” plays a rare “Brilliant Disguise” and “Across the Border,” and by request: a Danny Federici spotlight on “Beer Barrel Polka.”

2004: Bruce and the E Street Band rehearse at Asbury Park’s Convention Hall for their upcoming Vote for Change Tour.

2007: Sirius XM radio brings back E Street Radio for a return engagement to coincide with the release of Magic. At least as of this writing, it will never leave the air again.

2016: Bruce becomes a published author with the release of Born to Run, his autobiography. To promote the book, Bruce kicks off a national book tour at the Barnes & Noble in his hometown of Freehold, New Jersey.

2018: Springsteen on Broadway continues its theatrical run at the Walter Kerr Theater in New York City. Patti is sick tonight, so Bruce Broadway-debuts “Two Hearts” in place of his usual “Tougher Than the Rest” duet with his wife. In attendance tonight: Robert Gordon and Simple Minds.

2021: Bruce interviews Little Steven for a streaming event the following day, promoting Van Zandt’s new book, Unrequited Infatuations.

excerpt.rendered: The Born in the U.S.A. Tour starts its last stand, and Bruce becomes a published author. More highlights and lots of video inside.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Kingdom of Days: August 17
jetpack-related-posts.author: Ken
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Bruce plays "I'm Goin' Down" for the first time, wraps up his legendary 1975 stand at the Bottom Line, and more. Plus: a half-hour of 1992 Detroit soundcheck and performance footage!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Kingdom of Days: December 11
jetpack-related-posts.author: Ken
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Watch rare River Tour footage, a holiday performance with Conan O'Brien, an interview on Italian TV, and more.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Kingdom of Days: August 12
jetpack-related-posts.author: Ken
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: On this date: Mitch Ryder makes a "Detroit Medley" guest appearance, Bruce swings by the Yankees' clubhouse, the debut of the acoustic "Countin' on a Miracle" video, and more.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Kingdom of Days: October 17
jetpack-related-posts.author: Ken
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: On this date in Springsteen history: A live radio broadcast from The Roxy, guest appearances with The Knack and U2, and more.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Kingdom of Days: November 23
jetpack-related-posts.author: Ken
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Bruce's video for "Born in the U.S.A." premiered on MTV on this date--check out the coverage, plus: guest appearances by Bono, Dave Stewart, and Dion, Bruce's first-ever show in the Netherlands, and more.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Kingdom of Days: August 6
jetpack-related-posts.author: Ken
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Bruce finishes "Born to Run," says farewell to Jon Stewart on The Daily Show, shoots the video for "Leap of Faith" and records official live performances of "Nebraska," "No Surrender," and "Trapped." Lots of video and audio today.
